meanings.definition: A religious service held in the evening, typically in the Anglican Church.
meanings.sent1: The evensong at the church was peaceful and calming.
meanings.sent2: We attended the evensong at the Anglican Church last Sunday.
meanings.sent3: During the evensong, the choir accidentally sang the wrong hymn, causing a moment of confusion.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the evensong enveloped the church in a blanket of serenity.
meanings.sent5: The evensong echoed through the halls, filling the air with reverence.

meanings.definition: The time of day when this service is held.
meanings.sent1: The golden hues of the evensong sky painted a beautiful backdrop for the service.
meanings.sent2: At evensong, the church bells rang out, signaling the start of the evening service.
meanings.sent3: The evensong hour was a time of reflection and prayer for the community.
meanings.sent4: As the shadows lengthened, the evensong hour approached, marking the end of the day.
meanings.sent5: The evensong time brought a sense of peace and tranquility to all who gathered.
